Curious if anyone can relate on trying to isolate yourself from everything to basically hide your using or thinking you were just trying to hide the days when you were planning on tapering or quitting.
I would love to stop it all but I'm living alone and not working, not having a distraction or something to normalize my routine makes withdrawal 10x's worse.
I have dealing with this game for 2 months, I will not use for 3-4 days but would constantly relapse.

It's a similar mentality to someone using suboxone to get off heroin, but suboxone users commonly end up hating being on suboxone because the withdrawals from that are really no more easy than heroin,
Sometimes I think a work routine, being around co-workers, etc will be good to establish before jumping off all the way. Basically use Kratom like suboxone.
So, I'm a long time lurker who is curious to try his first shot.

Perhaps one of you will have something amazing to say.
42 days. 42 god-blessed days.
I'm actually looking forward to it, rather than mocking the whole process. I had planned to document daily, but I've left that idea behind.
I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged.

I wanted to thank all of you who responded to my previous post and encourage anyone who may read this another day. We can do it, and it's not shameful to be afraid and work through that fear with others.
That phenomenon of craving is so fucking real, and there has never been any doubt that I'm a true-blue addict regarding these pills.

What am I supposed to do? I know that I am a fucking jackass when it comes to this shit, but it isn't until the evening when I realize I can't live this way. I need some support and some conversation.

How long were you using for? Upon my answer of eight years, he replied: "You have to be realistic with yourself. Do you think you can be back where you want to be in one month after eight years of using? Exactly."

How will that end. The best case scenario is that you don’t OD, in which case you would just be using, getting sick, spending all of your money, always worrying, and surrounded by people who similarly only care about themselves- not because they are inherently bad people- but because they too are a slave to their own addiction.
Thank you for listening to my rant. I would love to hear from anyone going through this very difficult journey.

If you happen to be unlucky enough to have gotten the flu- would that not be a potentially perfect situation to just jump off? Since you are already experiencing all of the terrible physical symptoms whether you like it or not, I wonder if this situation would make it “easier” both physically and mentally, since you know you are already going to feel that way regardless of using or not.
I just want to write this so that those who are in the state and/or timeframe that I was in at this point two years ago to know that it gets so, so much better.
